programme.title: ALVINNN!!! and the Chipmunks

programme.title: The Loud House
programme.desc: Camped!: When Dad discovers that his childhood camp is closing, he decides to take the family for one final visit. They uncover a map that could lead to a treasure big enough to save it. (S5, ep 18)

programme.title: The Loud House

programme.title: Open Season: Call of Nature

programme.title: The Patrick Star Show

programme.title: The Patrick Star Show

programme.title: The Loud House

programme.title: Kamp Koral

programme.title: ALVINNN!!! and the Chipmunks

programme.title: ALVINNN!!! and the Chipmunks

programme.title: ALVINNN!!! and the Chipmunks

programme.title: ALVINNN!!! and the Chipmunks

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants

programme.title: SpongeBob SquarePants
programme.desc: SpongeBob and Patrick board a ship of prisoners going to jail in 'The Inmates Of Summer', and then in 'To Save A Squirrel', SpongeBob and Patrick stow away on one of Sandy's wilderness expeditions.

programme.title: A Child Is Waiting
programme.desc: 1963. Drama. Directed by John Cassavetes. Stars Burt Lancaster, Judy Garland & Gena Rowlands. A former music teacher, anxious to give her life some meaning, joins a state institution for children. [S]

programme.title: The Strange Woman
programme.desc: 1946. Drama. Directed by Edgar G. Ulmer. Stars Hedy Lamarr, George Sanders & Louis Hayward. A beautiful, yet heartless woman, marries a rich man but also seduces his son and company foreman. [S]

programme.title: The Rogues
programme.desc: 1965. The Boston Money Party. Gig Young, David Niven and Charles Boyer are The Rogues, members of two related families of international forgers and conmen. [S]

programme.title: Men Against the Sun
programme.desc: 1952. Adventure. Director Brendan J. Stafford. Stars John Bentley, Zena Marshall.. An adventurous story about the attempts to construct a railway in Africa at the turn of the century. [S]

programme.title: Hindle Wakes
programme.desc: 1952. Drama starring Leslie Dwyer and Lisa Daniely. Successful remake of one of the earliest British talkies. Set in the Hindle, two mill workers take off to Blackpool for the 'Wakes' holiday. [S]

programme.title: Star Performance: The Long Count
programme.desc: 1954. Drama. Directed by Alvin Ganzer. Stars Frank Lovejoy, Joan Vohs & Biff Elliot. Private detective McGraw finds himself in hot water when he investigates the murder of a boxer.

programme.title: Those People Next Door
programme.desc: 1953. Drama. Directed by John Harlow and starring Jack Warner, Charles Victor, Jimmy James & Anthony Newley. A young man's titled parents object to his working-class fiance. [S]

programme.title: Arsenal Stadium Mystery
programme.desc: 1939. Mystery. Director: Thorold Dickinson. Stars Leslie Banks, Greta Gynt, Ian McLean. Poison, death and mystery set at the Arsenal Stadium. Detective Slade is called to solve the crime. [S]

programme.title: Rebecca
programme.desc: Part 2. 1997. Stars Charles Dance, Timothy West & Emilia Fox. The new Mrs. de Winter attempts to establish herself as the mistress of Manderley, but Mrs. Danvers continues to taunt her. [S]

programme.title: What's On TPTV With Noel
programme.desc: Founder of Talking Pictures TV and one half of the Footage Detectives, Noel Cronin, shares shows and films not to be missed throughout May. [S]

programme.title: The Writing on the Wall
programme.desc: Mike Read's journey to find the Blue Plaques leads him to explore the stories of many interesting characters including Richard I, King John, Marilyn Monroe, Lord Byron and William Hayley. [S]

programme.title: This Happy Breed
programme.desc: 1944. Drama. Director: David Lean. Stars Robert Newton, Celia Johnson, John Mills & Stanley Holloway. After WW1, a family lead an ordinary sort of life until the outbreak of WW2. [S]

programme.title: The Super Secret Service
programme.desc: 1953. Comedy. Directed by Charles W. Green. Stars Peter Sellers, Graham Stark, Dick Emery & Raymond Francis. Brilliantly bizarre comedy short about the workings of the 'Super Secret Service'. [S]

programme.title: Journey to the Center of the Earth
programme.desc: 1988. Fantasy. Directed by Rusty Lemorande. Stars Nicola Cowper, Ilan Mitchell-Smith & Paul Carafotes. While exploring a Hawaiian cave, a group of youngsters discover the lost city of Atlantis. [S]

programme.title: Scotland Yard
programme.desc: 1961. Wings of Death. Directed by Allan Davis. Starring Harry H. Corbett, Peter Bowles and Simon Lack. A light aeroplane comes down in Kent, killing the pilot. It was no accident... (S1, E38)

programme.title: Strange But True
programme.desc: Venetian Palace Incident. 1996. Michael Aspel explores the story of a group of people who experienced a disturbance that cut their holiday in a Venetian Palace short. Featuring Joan Collins. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Caroline Munro opens the Cellar Club for more Doomwatch and another chilling feature film. First up is Doomwatch - The Human Time Bomb, about a case study of tower block life. [S]

programme.title: Doomwatch
programme.desc: The Human Time Bomb. 1971. Stars Jean Trend, Roddy McMillan & Patrick Godfrey. Dr Fay Chantry performs a biological study of tower block life - and finds far more than she expected. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Torment and terror are invited down into the Cellar Club as next up is the 1945 horror The Woman Who Came Back - a chilling story about witchcraft, suspicion and hysteria. [S]

programme.title: The Woman Who Came Back
programme.desc: 1945. Horror. Directed by Walter Colmes. Stars John Loder, Nancy Kelly & Otto Kruger. A woman returns to her hometown and becomes convinced that she has been possessed by a witch's spirit. [S]

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Before leaving the Cellar Club Caroline Munro takes a look at next week's captivating features. [S]

programme.title: Dr. Phibes Rises Again
programme.desc: 1972. Horror. Directed by Robert Fuest. Stars Vincent Price, Robert Quarry & Peter Cushing. The sinister Dr. Phibes rises again and seeks an ancient set of scrolls to resurrect his deceased wife. [S]

programme.title: Dr. Phibes Rises Again
programme.desc: 1972. Horror. Directed by Robert Fuest. Stars Vincent Price, Robert Quarry & Peter Cushing. The sinister Dr. Phibes rises again and seeks an ancient set of scrolls to resurrect his deceased wife. [S]

programme.title: Elmer Gantry
programme.desc: 1960. Drama. Directed by Richard Brooks. Stars Burt Lancaster, Jean Simmons & Arthur Kennedy. A fast-talking travelling salesman teams up with an evangelist to sell religion to 1920s America. [S]

programme.title: Castle Sinister
programme.desc: 1947. Drama. During the war, a British agent travels to the remote Glennye Castle in the wilds of Scotland to investigate a mysterious murder by a masked phantom. Directed by Oscar Burn. [S]

programme.title: Time To Remember
programme.desc: Standing Alone. 1964. Narrated by Sir Michael Redgrave. A recollection of events in 1940. France signs an Armistice at Compiegne and in Britain, the factories are humming to replace equipment. [S]

programme.title: Cinebox Memories
programme.desc: Rock and roll singer Vince Taylor brings an entrancing performance of Shakin' All Over.

programme.title: Sandokan: Pirate of Malaysia
programme.desc: 1964. Action. Director: Umberto Lenzi. Stars Steve Reeves, Jacqueline Sassard & Mimmo Palmara. Sandokan and his team of rebels attempt to stop a British General from forcing the Sultan to resign. [S]

programme.title: What's On TPTV With Noel
programme.desc: Founder of Talking Pictures TV and one half of the Footage Detectives, Noel Cronin, shares shows and films not to be missed throughout May. [S]

programme.title: Space Patrol
programme.desc: The Buried Spaceship. 1964. Stars Libby Morris. Dick Vosburgh & Ronnie Stevens. Operation Ice Cube begins when Marla suggests moving ice through space as a solution to a drought problem on Mars. [S]

programme.title: Batman
programme.desc: Hizzonner the Penguin. 1966. Stars Adam West & Burgess Meredith. Suspiciously endearing himself to the citizens of Gotham by foiling a robbery, the Penguin announces he is running for mayor. [S]

programme.title: Richard the Lionheart
programme.desc: King Arthur's Sword. 1962. Stars Dermot Walsh, Ferdy Mayne & Daphne Anderson. Richard refuses to believe that King Arthur's sword has been stolen and decides to visit the tomb where it is held. [S]

programme.title: Supercar
programme.desc: What Goes Up. 1961. Stars David Graham, George Murcell & Graydon Gould. A high altitude balloon test goes wrong, and Supercar is called to intercept the balloon before a greater disaster occurs. [S]

programme.title: Rockets in the Dunes
programme.desc: 1960. Director William C. Hammond. Stars Gena Yates, Heather Lyons & Gordon Adam. A group of children attempt to prevent the War Office from closing their beach to make a rocket-launching site. [S]

programme.title: The Adventures of Robin Hood
programme.desc: Hostage for a Hangman. 1960. Stars Richard Greene, John Arnatt, Jack Melford. Robin becomes troubled when he learns that the Sheriff plans to hang one serf a day until the outlaw gives himself up. [S]

programme.title: First Spaceship on Venus
programme.desc: 1960. Sci-fi. Director: Kurt Maetzig. Stars: Yôko Tani, Oldrich Lukes & Ignacy Machowski. A team of astronaut's travel to Venus to investigate the origins of an alien artifact discovered on Earth. [S]

programme.title: One Step Beyond
programme.desc: The Return of Mitchell Campion. 1959. Stars Patrick O'Neil, Lilyan Chauvin & Vance Howard. A man appears to be known by everyone on a small Mediterranean island he has never visited or has he? [S]

programme.title: Dick Barton: Special Agent
programme.desc: 1979. Writer: Julian Bond. Mr Parkes (Terence Seward), a playboy, & Mrs Aston (Marsha Fitzalan), wife of a Whitehall official, are threatened by the Drew Brothers (Ernie Drew by Bernard Kay).

programme.title: Fireball XL-5
programme.desc: The Granatoid Tanks. 1963. Stars David Graham, Sylvia Anderson & Paul Maxwell. Steve and the crew head to Planet 73 to save a couple of mineral researchers under attack by Granatoids.

programme.title: Captain Scarlet and the Mysterons
programme.desc: Dangerous Rendezvous. 1968. Stars Donald Gray & David Healy. Using a Mysteron pulsator, Dr Kurnitz develops a transmission device which Colonel White uses in an attempt to contact the Mysterons.

programme.title: Parade
programme.desc: 1974. Comedy. Directed by Jacques Tati. Stars Karl Kossmayer, Michele Brabo & Bertil Berglund. A tremendous spectacle combining music, circus acts and pantomime, hosted by comedian Jacques Tati. [S]

programme.title: Web of Suspicion
programme.desc: 1959. Crime. Directed by Max Varnel. Stars Philip Friend & Susan Beaumont. When a teacher is wrongly accused of murdering a pupil, he must clear his name and save the school from another tragedy. [S]

programme.title: Look At Life Put Out the Flags
programme.desc: 1967. A wonderful look at the world of flag makers and their flags.

programme.title: Z-Cars
programme.desc: Rip Off. 1977. Stars Brian Grellis & Norman Rossington. Bowker & Jack Crawford's relationship is simple; one way or another Bowker's going to nail Crawford, unless Crawford can nail Bowker first. [S]

programme.title: A Family At War
programme.desc: 1970. The End of the Beginning. Created by John Finch. Stars Colin Douglas & Shelagh Fraser. Changes to the family become apparent over Christmas as an old will is discovered. [S]

programme.title: Malta Story
programme.desc: 1953. War. Director: Brian Desmond Hurst. Stars Alec Guinness, Jack Hawkins, Muriel Pavlow, Anthony Steel & Flora Robson. British RAF face invasion on the strategic island of Malta during WW2. [S]

programme.title: Border Incident
programme.desc: 1949. Thriller. Directed by Anthony Mann. Stars Ricardo Montalban, George Murphy & Howard Da Silva. Two agents go undercover to stop the smuggling of Mexican migrant workers into California. [S]

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Tricky Tricks: Bear's old circus friend Tiger comes to visit. What could be more wonderful than to passionately play chess with your best friend? But Masha has her own idea of miracles. (S6 Ep4)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Think Outside the Box: Masha and Penguin go to Mars and from there they go straight to the open sea to the Frog Princess, and new adventures are already waiting for friends overboard. (S6 Ep5)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Well-beeing: What happens when bees overeat chocolates? Masha becomes their personal trainer! Get ready! Let's start weight loss exercises! (S6 Ep6)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Knock-knock-knock: The mysterious night visitor frightened the Bear and made a real mess in his house. But Masha knows the best way to overcome fear is to play with an invisible house spirit! (S6 Ep7)

programme.title: Masha And The Bear
programme.desc: Unfriended?: Red or yellow? Masha and the Bear argued which colour is more beautiful, and a wall grew between them. All this turns into exhausting competition of searching new friends. (S6 Ep8)

programme.title: Super Wings
programme.desc: Viking Voyage: Karl from Norway asks for a Viking helmet. He goes to Viking Camp where Jett is mistaken for a dragon. To run from the dragon, the campers get onto a ship. (S1 Ep17)

programme.title: Super Wings
programme.desc: Arctic Run: Anders from Greenland wants a sled for a dog sled race. Along the way, his team rides onto an iceberg that separates from the land and heads out to sea. (S1 Ep18)

programme.title: Super Wings
programme.desc: A Winning Recipe: Martine in Paris, France needs a cake-decorating machine. Her father the baker asks her to ice a giant cake for a party at the Eiffel Tower. (S1 Ep19)

programme.title: Super Wings
programme.desc: Follow That Ghost: Brigita from Romania hosts a spooky party and wants a flashlight that projects scary shapes. She hears an eerie sound and follows it. (S1 Ep20)

programme.title: Baby Born
programme.desc: Let's Go Camping! / Birthday Party!: Together, Emma and Teddy embark on an imaginative camping trip with delicious marshmallows and fun campfire songs. (S1 Ep3)

programme.title: Baby Born
programme.desc: Lucky Dog! / Snow!: Carla has a surprise for Emma: Lucky Dog! He's such a good doggy. Emma loves playing with her new friend. Carla and Conrad are so excited. (S1 Ep4)

programme.title: The Miniwhats
programme.desc: Mustard's Little Brother: Mustard is annoyed because he has to take care of his little brother, Braylon, who drives everyone crazy. (S1 Ep6)

programme.title: The Miniwhats
programme.desc: The Tooth Fairy: Pamela lost a tooth, but the Tooth Fairy didn't visit her. The MiniWhats are outraged, so they set off in pursuit of the evil Tooth Fairy. (S1 Ep7)

programme.title: The Miniwhats

programme.title: Billy The Cowboy Hamster

programme.title: Billy The Cowboy Hamster
programme.desc: Billy's Gang: Billy dreams of being a cowboy, like his hero Jessy Dog. But you can't be a cowboy without intrepid companions! (S1 Ep40)

programme.title: Billy The Cowboy Hamster
programme.desc: Christmas At The Ranch: It's Christmas Eve! While taking the bunnies home, Billy, Suzie, and Jean-Claude come across Santa Claus, who has just had a sleigh accident. (S1 Ep41)

programme.title: Billy The Cowboy Hamster
programme.desc: A Mysterious Call: At the ranch, Billy, Suzie, and JC find Scott's old sled in the attic. Billy dreams of going down "Old Snowy" just like his dad did, and the friends set off! (S1 Ep42)

programme.title: Go! Go! Cory Carson

programme.title: Go! Go! Cory Carson

programme.title: Go! Go! Cory Carson

programme.title: Go! Go! Cory Carson
programme.desc: Speed Limits: Things get out of hand on the playground when Cory takes over as School Safety Monitor. (S1 Ep7)

programme.title: Go! Go! Cory Carson

programme.title: Dino Ranch
